to.devNote: FIXME: Node 3 could be used to reset the room, with additional requirements.

strats.name: Blockade Leave with Moondance
note: Break exactly the bottom-right and top-right Bomb Blocks and Unmorph while on the top block hole, to begin the Moondance.
Clear a path to the left in advance, as well as all enemies.

strats.name: Blockade Leave with Extended Moondance
note: Break exactly the bottom-right and top-right Bomb Blocks and Unmorph while on the top block hole, to begin the Moondance.
Clear a path to the left in advance, as well as all enemies.
Moonfall a total of 321 times, stopping just before Samus clips two tiles into the ground.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Zeela
Blockade Extended Moondance Clip
note: Break exactly the lower-middle-right and top-right Bomb Blocks, leaving the upper-middle-right and bottommost Blocks intact.
Clear all enemies before starting.
Unmorph while on the top block to begin the Moondance.
Exactly 145 moonfalls after clipping into the bottom block (321 total), wiggle out to the left.
The next moonfall will clip Samus down two tiles.
Re-enable Screw Attack and moonfall to break the right side blocks, then use Grapple again to become unstuck.
Finally, moonfall through the Speed Blocks to clip down to the Dachora.

strats.name: G-Mode Screw and Overload PLMs
strats.note: Screw Attack through the bomb block wall, to instantly overload PLMs on the other side, and fall through the Speed Blocks.

strats.name: Blockade Leave with Moondance
note: Break exactly the lower-middle-right and top-right Bomb Blocks, leaving the upper-middle-right and bottommost Blocks intact.
Clear all enemies before starting.
Unmorph while on the top block to begin the Moondance.
Wiggle out to the left and use SpeedBooster to run through to the right side door.

strats.name: Blockade Leave with Extended Moondance
note: Break exactly the lower-middle-right and top-right Bomb Blocks, leaving the upper-middle-right and bottommost Blocks intact.
Clear all enemies before starting.
Unmorph while on the top block to begin the Moondance.
Exactly 145 moonfalls after clipping into the bottom block (321 total), wiggle out to the left.
The next moonfall will clip Samus down two tiles.
Finally use Screw Attack or SpeedBooster to break the Bomb blocks and reach the right side door.

strats.name: Transition with Stored Fall Speed (more speed)
strats.note: It is possible to break the Bomb blocks using Screw Attack in a Moonfall, then escape the tiles with Grapple Beam.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Power Bomb
strats.note: Use a Power Bomb to destroy the bomb block wall.

strats.name: X-Ray Climb
strats.note: 6 screen X-Ray climb, and global Zeelas are still active even off camera.

strats.name: Very Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
note: Enter with G-mode direct, back up to between 1 and 6 pixels from the door transition, and activate X-ray to get very deep stuck in the door.
Climb up 6 screens, and perform a turnaround buffered spin-jump away from the door to trigger the transition, bypassing any lock on the door.

strats.name: G-Mode Overload PLMs
strats.note: There are camera scroll blocks just below the speed blocks, so it is easy to overload PLMs by wall jumping or space jumping into them.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Overload PLMs
note: There are camera scroll blocks just below the speed blocks, so it is easy to overload PLMs by bouncing into them.
A single IBJ is slow enough at the top to overload them before Samus can hit the blocks.

strats.name: Spark from Floor
strats.note: Diagonal spark left to save health.

strats.name: Spark from Speedy Jump
strats.note: Diagonal spark left to save health.

strats.name: Dachora Room Shinespark No Etanks No HiJump
strats.note: Quickly wall jump up the right wall and shinespark up to barely get above the speed blocks without any tanks.
strats.devNote: At no etanks, the spark will always be cut short barely above the speed blocks.

strats.name: G-Mode Overload PLMs
strats.note: There are camera scroll blocks just below the speed blocks, so it is easy to overload PLMs by wall jumping or space jumping into them.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Overload PLMs
note: There are camera scroll blocks just below the speed blocks, so it is easy to overload PLMs by bouncing into them.
A single IBJ is slow enough at the top to overload them before Samus can hit the blocks.

strats.name: Base
note: To break the bomb blocks with speedbooster without falling down, stand under the lower ceiling at the right and hold run before pressing forward.
If it doesn't work, back up a little and try again.

strats.name: Metaree Leave with Moondance
note: Freeze one of the Metarees at a height where Samus can become stuck and then use it to Moondance.
Stop after 175 Moonfalls, before Samus clips into the ground.

strats.name: Transition with Stored Fall Speed (more speed)
strats.note: It is possible to break the Bomb blocks using Screw Attack in a Moonfall, then escape the tiles with Grapple Beam.

strats.name: G-Mode Overload PLMs
strats.note: Use The camera scroll blocks above the speed blocks and by the bomb wall to overload PLMs.

strats.name: Grapple Teleport X-Ray Climb
note: Exit the previous room with Samus in a standing pose (while grappled).
After teleporting, press right to release Grapple while staying standing (not being forced into a crouch).
Then X-ray climb to get up to the door transition, without needing to open the door.

strats.name: Dachora Room Reo Zeela Stuck Moonfall
note: Use a Reo (Bee) and a Zeela to perform an 'Enemy Stuck Moonfall', clipping Samus through the Speed blocks.
Break the Bomb blocks to bring enemies over to the Speed blocks.
Have a Reo wait off camera while the Zeela walks onto the Speed blocks, then freeze the Bee just above Samus' head.
Try to freeze both enemies near the same time and start the moonfall as quickly as possible.

strats.name: Metaree Moondance
note: Freeze one of the Metarees at a height where Samus can become stuck and then use it to Moondance.
After exactly 175 Moonfalls, before Samus clips into the ground, walk over to the Speed Blocks to perform the clip.

strats.name: G-Mode Overload PLMs
strats.note: Use The camera scroll blocks above the speed blocks and by the bomb wall to overload PLMs.

strats.name: Dachora Room G-Mode Setup - Lure the Zeela Down Below
note: Using Speed Booster, run through and break the bomb wall to free the global Zeela.
Break the speed blocks just before the Zeela gets to them in order for it to go down to the bottom half of the room.
The speed blocks respawn very quickly, so this requires very precise timing.
Normally, it takes the Zeela a minimum of 2 minutes to setup, but a super can make it fall down the shaft, saving 30 seconds.
It may be easiest to knock the Zeela from the ceiling directly into the hole, saving another 30 seconds:
Shoot a well-timed Super diagonally at the ground just before breaking the speed blocks.

strats.name: Metaree Leave with Moondance
note: Freeze one of the Metarees at a height where Samus can become stuck and then use it to Moondance.
Stop after exactly 175 Moonfalls, before Samus clips into the ground.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Zeela or Reo

nodes.name: Left Side - Top Middle Door (Main Entrance)
Left Side - Middle Doorway (Behind the Power Bomb Blocks)
Left Side - Bottom Middle Door (Blocked by Crumble Blocks)
nodes.note: Samus is considered to spawn at 14 because of the crumble blocks. This can be negated by performing a stationary spin jump when entering, allowing her to 'get back to 5'

nodes.name: Right Side - Bottom Middle Door (Behind the Super Block)
Left Side - Botom Middle Door Spawn At Junction
nodes.note: A junction used as a midpoint between 5 and 13 to express that a tech is required to access 5

nodes.name: G-Mode Morph Junction (Middle Right)
nodes.note: Represents being on the second platform coming out of the right wall above the door to the Pink Hopper Room. This is below the floating platform by the Grapple blocks.

devNote: FIXME: There are fancy (difficult) ways to jump into the room and shoot the super block and mockball at full speed.
The 135% strat uses spacejump to enter the room in a particular way, but maybe a normal jump would work.
And momentum is used to shoot the super block but takes a setup to aim.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Zeb
note: Carefully lure a Zeb from the pipe.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Overload PLMs with Power Bombs and Spring Ball
note: Roll through the camera scroll blocks and then through the bomb block.
Avoiding the Sidehoppers can be tricky.
Continue through the room to the Sidehoppers below the Grapple blocks, and carefully kill both of them with a single Power Bomb.
Bounce up through the crumble blocks to the door to the left

strats.name: G-mode Morph Overload PLMs with Power Bombs and Spring Ball, Break Power Bomb Blocks
note: Roll through the camera scroll blocks and then through the bomb block.
Avoiding the Sidehoppers can be tricky.
Continue through the room to the Sidehoppers below the Grapple blocks, and carefully kill both of them with a single Power Bomb.
Bounce up through the crumble blocks to the door to the left
Use a Power Bomb then quickly exit G-Mode before it explodes to also break the blocks.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Overload PLMs with Power Bombs
note: Roll through the camera scroll blocks and then through the bomb block.
Avoiding the Sidehoppers can be tricky.
Carefully roll through the rest of the room and through the bomb blocks to the lowest item.
strats.devNote: With Morph, Bombs, or Spring Ball, 1->15->12 will be used instead.

strats.name: Blue Spring Ball Bounce
strats.devNote: Higher speeds can work but are more difficult.

strats.name: Temporary Blue Bounce (Come In With Temporary Blue)
G-mode Morph
strats.note: Roll through the camera scroll blocks and then through the bomb block.

strats.name: G-mode Morph
note: Roll through the camera scroll blocks and then through the bomb block.
Avoiding the hoppers can be tricky.

strats.name: G-mode Morph
strats.note: Roll through the camera scroll blocks and then through the bomb block.

strats.name: Speedball (Come In Getting Blue Speed)
note: Jump over the bug pipe while blue and roll into the morph tunnel to break the bomb block.
Shortcharge too much and the jump will not be able to reach the morph tunnel.
strats.devNote: Half a tile is unusable so you can jump over the pipe.

strats.name: Leave with Spark - Shinecharge Below and Jump Up
G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Zeb
note: Lure a Zeb from the pipe.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Overload PLMs with Power Bombs and Spring Ball
note: Overload PLMs using the camera scroll blocks in front of the bomb blocks to the top left door.
Avoiding the Sidehoppers can be tricky.
Continue through the room to the Sidehoppers below the Grapple blocks, and carefully kill both of them with a single Power Bomb.
Bounce up through the crumble blocks to the door to the left

strats.name: G-mode Morph Overload PLMs with Power Bombs and Spring Ball, Break Power Bomb Blocks
note: Overload PLMs using the camera scroll blocks in front of the bomb blocks to the top left door.
Avoiding the Sidehoppers can be tricky.
Continue through the room to the Sidehoppers below the Grapple blocks, and carefully kill both of them with a single Power Bomb.
Bounce up through the crumble blocks to the door to the left
Use a Power Bomb then quickly exit G-Mode before it explodes to also break the blocks.

strats.name: G-mode Morph with Power Bombs and Overload PLMs
note: Use a Power Bomb to boost horizontally to the Morph tunnel to the left and overload PLMs using the camera scroll blocks in front of the bomb blocks.
Carefully roll through the rest of the room and through the bomb blocks to the lowest item.
strats.devNote: With Morph, Bombs, or Spring Ball, 1->15->12 will be used instead.

strats.name: G-mode Morph
strats.note: Avoiding the hoppers can be tricky.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Zeb
note: Carefully lure a Zeb from the pipe below while freezing it.
Samus must start to the left of the pipe in order for the Zeb to move left at the end.

strats.name: Big Pink Extended Moondance Clip
note: Setup a Moondance such that Samus will fall through 2 tiles
Moonfall towards the door, aim down while falling, and turn around twice.
strats.devNote: FIXME: A different exact fall speed value changes the movements needed for the clip.

strats.name: Big Pink Crumble Path Leave With Shinecharge
strats.note: Use the morph tunnel that used to have crumble blocks as a faster path to the Mission Impossible transition.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Power Bomb
strats.note: Use a Power Bomb, then exit G-Mode.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Zeb
note: Carefully lure a Zeb from the pipe below while freezing it.
Samus must start to the left of the pipe in order for the Zeb to move left at the end.

strats.name: Shinespark Deep Transition X-Ray Climb
note: Perform a horizontal shinespark through the door transition, from a horizontal position that triggers a deep transition in the door.
Sparking from one or two pixels away from the door is an example position that works (if possible in the neighboring room).

In general, about one third of positions will work, with working positions occuring in periodic windows that are each approximately two pixels wide, separated by bad windows that are approximately 4 pixels wide.
If successful, Samus will spawn inside the Power Bomb blocks.
After the shinespark crash animation ends, Samus should be standing and able to X-Ray climb.

strats.name: Unpause Deep Transition X-Ray Climb (Run Forward)
note: Stand facing the door in the previous room, at a specific distance from the door, approximately a 3-pixel window at an effective distance of a 6-tile closed-end runway (taking into account how slopes can modify the effective distance).
Pause, then unpause while holding dash and right.
If positioned correctly, the unpause fade-in will finish on the exact frame that the transition would occur, delaying the transition by a frame.
Samus will spawn standing inside the Power Bomb blocks and be able to X-Ray climb.

strats.name: Unpause Deep Transition X-Ray Climb (Turnaround Run)
note: Stand facing away from the door in the previous room, at a specific distance from the door, approximately a 2-pixel window at an effective distance of 3.7 tiles (taking into account how slopes can modify the effective distance).
Pause, then unpause while holding dash and right.
If positioned correctly, the unpause fade-in will finish on the exact frame that the transition would occur, delaying the transition by a frame.
Samus will spawn standing inside the Power Bomb blocks and be able to X-Ray climb.

strats.name: Big Pink Left-Side X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 1 screen.
devNote: Normally, an XRayClimb's resetRoom has mustStayPut true, but because node 5 is configured to spawn at 14, Samus will be expected to visit 14 before 5 when setting up.
This is a technicality based on the spawnAt at 14, since in reality Samus just gets doorstuck at 5 immediately in this scenario.
It's also possible to X-Ray Climb to 13, but that's reachable for free just by falling down the crumble blocks anyway.

strats.name: Very Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
note: Enter with G-mode direct, back up to between 1 and 6 pixels from the door transition, and activate X-ray to get very deep stuck in the door.
Climb up 4 screens, and perform a turnaround buffered spin-jump away from the door to trigger the transition, bypassing any lock on the door.

strats.name: Leave With Runway - Frozen Zeb
note: Kill the Reos in the hallway in front of the door, then go down and stand to the right of the Zeb spawner.
Freeze the Zeb before it starts going horizontally then go up and wait for it.
As the Zeb gets high enough, walk out of the doorway at the right time to get it to move horizontally at the optimal height.
This is much easier with Morph - instead be morphed in the hallway and once the Zeb starts moving towards Samus, freeze it.
strats.devNote: FIXME: This could be used at 4, or a Reo could be used at 5, but that would be pretty terrible.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Zeb
note: Carefully lure a Zeb from the pipe below.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Overload PLMs
strats.note: Overload PLMs by moving through the camera scroll blocks in front of the passageway leading to the exit of Spore Spawn Supers.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Direct Overload PLMs by Moving Through Missile Item
strats.note: Carefully roll off of the edge and land on the platform holding the item. Roll through it until PLMs are overloaded, then roll through the bomb blocks and down below.

strats.name: G-mode Morph
strats.note: If using Bombs, lure and kill the Reo. If using Spring Ball, it's important to release jump before reaching to peak of each jump to outrun the Reo.

strats.name: Big Pink Super Block Speedball
strats.note: Quickly jump and precisely shoot the super block and in the same motion take out the bomb blocks with a speedball.
strats.devNote: The runway here has two unusable tiles.

strats.name: Temporary Blue Springball Bounce (Come in Shinecharging)
note: Position Samus next to the Super block, while keeping the speed effect with a Temporary Blue Chain, and break it.
Then bounce into the morph tunnel, while keeping speed, and continuing all the way through with SpringBall
Avoiding the Temporary Blue Chain is possible, but harder.

strats.name: Temporary Blue Springball Bounce (Come in With Temporary Blue)
note: Position Samus next to the Super block, while keeping the speed effect with a Temporary Blue Chain, and break it.
Then bounce into the morph tunnel, while keeping speed, and continuing all the way through with SpringBall

strats.name: G-mode Morph Overload PLMs with Power Bombs and Spring Ball
note: While using multiple Power Bomb boost Spring Ball jumps, to climb the room,
overload PLMs by moving through the camera scroll blocks in front of the passageway leading to the exit of Spore Spawn Supers.
Note that one Power Bomb can be saved by carefully jumping out of this morph passageway.
Kill or carefully dodge the Sidehoppers at the top, then Power Bomb boost Spring Ball jump up to the top left door and exit G-Mode.
strats.devNote: With Morph, Bombs, or Spring Ball + HiJump, 8->15->1 will be used instead.

strats.name: Very Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
note: Enter with G-mode direct, back up to between 1 and 6 pixels from the door transition, and activate X-ray to get very deep stuck in the door.
Climb up 6 screens, and perform a turnaround buffered spin-jump away from the door to trigger the transition, bypassing any lock on the door.

strats.name: G-mode Morph with Power Bombs and Spring Ball
note: While using multiple Power Bomb boost Spring Ball jumps, to climb the room,
overload PLMs by moving through the camera scroll blocks in front of the passageway leading to the exit of Spore Spawn Supers.
Carefully dodge the Reos to the left of the door leading to the Pink Hopper Room and lure them and the Sidehoppers close to each other.
Place a Power Bomb to kill them and both Sidehoppers above.
Get into the Sidehopper pit and jump up and into the tunnel and go through the crumble blocks to the door to the left.
strats.devNote: With Morph, Bombs, or Spring Ball + HiJump, 8->15->4 will be used instead.

strats.name: G-mode Morph with Power Bombs and Spring Ball, Break Power Bomb Blocks
note: While using multiple Power Bomb boost Spring Ball jumps, to climb the room,
overload PLMs by moving through the camera scroll blocks in front of the passageway leading to the exit of Spore Spawn Supers.
Carefully dodge the Reos to the left of the door leading to the Pink Hopper Room and lure them and the Sidehoppers close to each other.
Place a Power Bomb to kill them and both Sidehoppers above.
Get into the Sidehopper pit and jump up and into the tunnel and go through the crumble blocks to the door to the left.
Use a Power Bomb then quickly exit G-Mode before it explodes to also break the blocks.
strats.devNote: With Morph, Bombs, or Spring Ball + HiJump, 8->15->4 will be used instead.

strats.name: Very Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
note: Enter with G-mode direct, back up to between 1 and 6 pixels from the door transition, and activate X-ray to get very deep stuck in the door.
Climb up 2 screens, and perform a turnaround buffered spin-jump away from the door to trigger the transition, bypassing any lock on the door.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Overload PLMs
strats.note: Overload PLMs by moving through the camera scroll blocks in front of the passageway leading to the exit of Spore Spawn Supers.
strats.devNote: Using a Power Bomb boost into Spring Ball will not work, as it will make the blocks remain solid.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Direct Overload PLMs by Moving Through Missile Item
strats.note: Roll through it until PLMs are overloaded, then roll through the bomb blocks and down below.
strats.devNote: With more items, the strat with camera scroll blocks will be used.

strats.name: Big Pink Right-Side X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 1 screen.

strats.name: G-mode with Crystal Flash Clip and Overloading PLMs
note: Go into the morph tunnel below the Charge Beam location and Crystal Flash to force a standup and jump through.
Samus is now unable to use X-Ray. Overload PLMs using the camera scroll blocks on the path upward, then go through the bomb blocks.
Go up to the Sidehopper pit and go up through the crumble blocks and through to the next room.
strats.devNote: This is only useful to save a wall jump.

strats.name: G-mode with Crystal Flash Clip
note: Go into the morph tunnel below the Charge Beam location and Crystal Flash to force a standup and jump through.
Samus is now unable to use X-Ray. Without Morph, be careful not to overload PLMs using the camera scroll blocks on the path upward.
Then partially floor clip into the left side of the bomb block, and jump to clip through and escape.
To exit G-Mode, damage down until the reserves trigger, which can be done most quickly using the Sidehoppers.
strats.devNote: This assumes Samus has many Energy Tanks, which will take a while to empty.

strats.name: Charge Escape Clip
strats.note: Partially floor clip into the left side of the bomb block above the charge beam location. Then jump to clip through the above tile.

strats.name: Speedball (In-Room)
note: Jump over the bug pipe while blue and roll into the morph tunnel to break the bomb block.
Shortcharge too much and the jump will not be able to reach the morph tunnel.
But you can airball and bounce into the tunnel.
strats.devNote: Half a tile unusable so you can jump over the pipe.

strats.name: Temporary Blue with SpringBall Bounce
note: Build a ShineCharge on the below platform and bring it up to the morph tunnel by chaining Temporary Blue.
Aim to bounce into the tunnel opening and use springball to bounce the rest of the way while blue.

strats.name: Big Pink Fast Mockball Leave With Spark
strats.note: Shinecharge towards the top right door.  Then turn around for a fast mockball after jumping the bug pipe.

strats.name: Big Pink Return Through Crumble Blocks
strats.note: The Crumble Block next to the Power Bomb Blocks does not respawn, so it's possible to enter from this door, grab the items, and return without breaking the Power Bomb blocks.

strats.name: Big Pink Wall Ice Clip the Mission Impossible Crumble Blocks
note: Freeze a Zeb inside of the crumble blocks below the entrance to the Power Bomb room and use it to get stuck inside the crumble blocks, breaking them.
Repeatedly freeze a left facing Zeb from the enemy spawner lower in the room.
Freeze it close to the right side of the crumble block so that Samus will attach to the enemy when rolling into it.
Finally, jump with Bombs or SpringBall to break the crumble block.

strats.name: Big Pink Reo Ice Clip With Morph and X-Ray
note: Lure the Reo (Bee) to the left to use it as a platform for ice clipping up through the crumbles to the Power Bomb room exit door.
Watch the Reo bounce against the left wall until it does a slow hover towards Samus.
There is a very small timing of when its right claw is above the small pale spore next to the big red spore, when Samus should jump to be above the Reo.
Crouching with Samus' front toe beneath this spore (facing left) will cause the bee to fly with the correct timing after Samus takes knockback damage, with a 3 pixel window.
This will cause it to fly left and into the two tile gap below the crumble blocks.
Freeze it once to get above it, and then again for the ice clip.
Once it is up there, the bee will become stuck and the room will need to be reset.
But if the Reo does not fit in the hole, it is possible to just wait near the ledge for another slow hover to try again.
With this strat, there is at most a two-frame window in which the Reo can be frozen.
One frame (setup dependent) may let Samus crouch jump through the block; the next frame Samus can use Morph and X-Ray to clip through.

strats.name: Big Pink Reo Ice Clip Without Morph and X-Ray
note: Lure the Reo (Bee) to the left to use it as a platform for ice clipping up through the crumbles to the Power Bomb room exit door.
Watch the Reo bounce against the left wall until it does a slow hover towards Samus.
There is a very small timing of when its right claw is above the small pale spore next to the big red spore, when Samus should jump to be above the Reo.
Crouching with Samus' front toe beneath this spore (facing left) will cause the bee to fly with the correct timing after Samus takes knockback damage, with a 3 pixel window.
This will cause it to fly left and into the two tile gap below the crumble blocks.
Freeze it once to get above it, and then again for the ice clip.
Once it is up there, the bee will become stuck and the room will need to be reset.
But if the Reo does not fit in the hole, it is possible to just wait near the ledge for another slow hover to try again.
With this setup, there is a one-frame window in which the Reo can be frozen. Without a precise setup, there is typically no way to clip through without Morph and X-Ray.

strats.name: Big Pink Zeb Ice Clip
note: Raise a Zeb to be just below the crumble blocks and blindly freeze it to set up an ice clip to reach the Power Bomb room exit door.
Get a bug from the pipe to spawn facing left and freeze it while moving to the ledge below the Hopper room door.
While crouched, a spazer or wave beam shot will shoot through the floor in front of Samus.
The bug must be frozen at a height between where Samus is crouched and where she is standing.
Once frozen, somehow track how long until the freeze effect expires, and when the bug will reach the crumble blocks.
If the bug is off camera when not frozen, it will despawn.
Refreeze the Zeb below the crumble blocks and ice clip up to reach the door.

strats.name: Big Pink Blind Zeb Ice Clip (Preserve Flash Suit)
note: Raise a Zeb to be just below the crumble blocks and blindly freeze it to set up an ice clip to reach the Power Bomb room exit door.
Get a bug from the pipe to spawn facing left and freeze it while moving to the ledge below the Hopper room door.
While crouched, a spazer or wave beam shot will shoot through the floor in front of Samus.
Shoot then immediately jump so that the bug can be frozen at a pixel perfect height, which is higher than where it would typically be frozen (when not needing to preserve a flash suit).
Once frozen, wait for the bug to thaw, then blindly follow it to the left without letting it go off camera, which would cause it to despawn.
Refreeze it below the crumble blocks, perform a very precise ledge grab onto it, then jump through the crumble block to reach the door, all while carefully avoiding losing the flash suit.

strats.name: Return Through Broken Super Block
devNote: This base strat represents only backtracking after entering from 7.
It is possible to avoid a mid-air morph by rolling off the platform above

strats.name: Big Pink Off Screen Super Block
note: Break the bomb blocks then shoot a super into the morph tunnel to break the super block off screen.
Requires pixel precision, although there are several pixels that work. The camera must be fully scrolled to the right, which may require going far left and back.
strats.devNote: It is possible to avoid a mid-air morph by rolling off the platform above

strats.name: Big Pink Crystal Flash Standup - Super Block
strats.note: Crystal Flash in the morph tunnel to force a standup, making it possible to shoot the super block from the left while it's on-screen.

strats.name: Big Pink Speedball Jump into Raised Bomb Blocks
strats.note: Break the bomb blocks by jumping into them with speed. These is more easily done at low run speed.

strats.name: Big Pink Temporary Blue Bounce into Raised Bomb Blocks
strats.note: Stop with Temporary Blue in front of the bomb blocks then jump and bounce into the morph tunnel to clear them.

strats.name: Leave With Spring Ball Bounce
note: Perform a precise mockball or speedball into the morph tunnel.
Then spring ball bounce through the door.
strats.devNote: Higher run speeds are possible but more difficult.

strats.name: Leave With Temporary Blue (Spring Ball Bounce)
note: Stop with temporary blue in front of the bomb blocks then jump and bounce all the way through the morph tunnel.
On the other side, unmorph and chain temporary blue through the door.

strats.name: Guide Enemy to Grapple Blocks
note: Lead an enemy through parts of the room as a way to reach the Mission Impossible missile location.
The respawning Zeb can be used by carfeully keeping it on camera and staying high enough that it does not attack.
Wait for it to respawn before attempting to guide it.
Or a Reo can be brought up to this section of room, but sometimes gets stuck on the way.
strats.devNote: This is just to avoid walljumping.

strats.name: Zeb Farm
strats.devNote: FIXME: Other nodes could be used to reset the room, with additional requirements.

strats.name: Land in Door Frame
strats.note: Jump through the door and shoot it open as you enter, landing on the door frame to avoid falling through the crumbles.

strats.name: G-mode Morph
note: Carefully dodge the Sidehoppers, or kill them with a Power Bomb. Be careful not to hit the bomb block with the Power Bomb or it will remain solid.
With IBJ alone, it is easiest to IBJ from the bug pipe below to the ceiling, luring the Sidehoppers to the left.
At the top, overload PLMs using the camera scroll block just in front of the block, then roll through it.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Overload PLMs with Power Bombs and Spring Ball
note: Go down and overload PLMs by moving through the camera scroll blocks in front of the passageway leading to the exit of Spore Spawn Supers.
Use multiple Power Bomb boost Spring Ball jumps, to climb the room; note that one Power Bomb can be saved by carefully jumping out of this morph passageway.
Kill or carefully dodge the Sidehoppers at the top, then Power Bomb boost Spring Ball jump up to the top left door and exit G-Mode.

strats.name: G-mode Overload PLMs with Morph
note: Overload PLMs by moving through the camera scroll blocks in front of the passageway leading to the exit of Spore Spawn Supers,
or in front of the bomb block at the top left door. Safely kill the enemies, then mid-air morph and go through the crumble blocks.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Overload PLMs with Bombs
note: If there are no Sidehoppers in the bottom right corner of their pen, roll down and carefully place bombs while luring and killing them.
Otherwise, go down into the hallway below and carefully kill the two Reos and lure the Sidehoppers to the left.
If they don't stay on the left, exit this hallway and enter it again to reset the camera and try again.
Go up through the crumble blocks to the left. If PLMs are not yet overloaded, place Bombs next to the crumble blocks.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Overload PLMs with Bombs, Break Power Bomb Blocks
note: If there are no Sidehoppers in the bottom right corner of their pen, roll down and carefully place bombs while luring and killing them.
Otherwise, go down into the hallway below and carefully kill the two Reos and lure the Sidehoppers to the left.
If they don't stay on the left, exit this hallway and enter it again to reset the camera and try again.
Go up through the crumble blocks to the left. If PLMs are not yet overloaded, place Bombs next to the crumble blocks.
Use a Power Bomb then quickly exit G-Mode before it explodes to also break the blocks.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Overload PLMs with Power Bombs and Spring Ball
note: Carefully dodge the Reos to the left of the door leading to the Pink Hopper Room and lure them and the Sidehoppers close to each other.
Place a Power Bomb to kill them and both Sidehoppers above. Go down below and lure the third Reo, below the Zeb pipe, off screen to the left.
Overload PLMs by moving through the camera scroll blocks in front of the passageway leading to the exit of Spore Spawn Supers.
Either carefully jump out of this morph tunnel or use a Power Bomb boost Spring Ball jump to get up to the ledge.
Get into the Sidehopper pit and jump up and into the tunnel and go through the crumble blocks to the door to the left.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Overload PLMs with Power Bombs and Spring Ball, Break Power Bomb Blocks
note: Carefully dodge the Reos to the left of the door leading to the Pink Hopper Room and lure them and the Sidehoppers close to each other.
Place a Power Bomb to kill them and both Sidehoppers above. Go down below and lure the third Reo, below the Zeb pipe, off screen to the left.
Overload PLMs by moving through the camera scroll blocks in front of the passageway leading to the exit of Spore Spawn Supers.
Either carefully jump out of this morph tunnel or use a Power Bomb boost Spring Ball jump to get up to the ledge.
Get into the Sidehopper pit and jump up and into the tunnel and go through the crumble blocks to the door to the left.
Use a Power Bomb then quickly exit G-Mode before it explodes to also break the blocks.

strats.name: G-mode Morph with Bombs
note: If there are no Sidehoppers in the bottom right corner of their pen, roll down and carefully place bombs while luring and killing them.
Otherwise, go down into the hallway below and carefully kill the two Reos and lure the Sidehoppers to the left.
If they don't stay on the left, exit this hallway and enter it again to reset the camera and try again. Then IBJ up to the item above.
strats.devNote: An equivalent strat with using a Power Bomb isn't needed as it is the same requirements as getting to 4 with the blocks broken.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Overload PLMs
strats.note: Overload PLMs by moving through the camera scroll blocks in front of the passageway leading to the exit of Spore Spawn Supers.

strats.name: G-mode Morph Power Bomb the Blocks
note: Use a Power Bomb to kill any Sidehoppers in the pit below, then roll off and use a second, while exiting G-Mode to destroy the blocks in front of the door.
Place the Power Bomb far enough left to hit the blocks, but not so far as to lure the Sidehopper.
This is when Samus is on the right-most squiggly plant, or when there is one tile of air between the right wall and the edge of the screen.

nodes.name: Top Left Junction
nodes.note: The top left section of the room, where the Super block is

strats.name: Leave Shinecharged (Unbroken Super Block)
strats.devNote: Spikes cannot be used as openEnds.

strats.name: Leave Shinecharged (Spike I-frames, Unbroken Super Block)
note: Stand to the right of the center spike
Run to the left, and continue running left while getting knocked back right by the spike.
The spike i-frames allow shortcharging while running through the left two spike blocks.
After gaining a shinecharge, turn back right, run, and jump through the door.
strats.devNote: Spikes cannot be used as openEnds.

strats.name: Leave Shinecharged (X-Mode)
strats.devNote: Two spike hits are expected per attempt (with any additional leniency hits being multiplied by this amount).

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Sidehopper
note: It's fastest to kill the first hopper safely from inside the doorway, then lure the second one over.

strats.name: Tank the Damage while Running Through
note: 2 hits are expected to be taken.
The first can be either from a Sidehopper or from a spike.
Second hit will be from a Sidehopper.
It is possible to avoid the first hit by opening the door and standing in the doorway while killing the first hopper.

strats.name: Power Beam Sidehopper Kill
strats.devNote: FIXME: Coming in with blue or sparking may be another way to kill the Hoppers.

strats.name: Morph Power Beam Sidehopper Kill
strats.note: Morph reduces damage because the ceiling Sidehopper can't reach a Morphed Samus.

strats.name: Intermediate Weapon Sidehopper Kill
strats.note: Pseudo Screw can help with the Sidehopper kills.

strats.name: Morph Intermediate Weapon Sidehopper Kill
strats.note: Morph reduces damage because the ceiling Sidehopper can't reach a morphed Samus.

strats.name: Safe Weapon Sidehopper Kill
strats.note: All beam weapons that can take out a Sidehopper in 5 hits or less can reliably take out the Sidehoppers damage-free.

strats.name: Doorway Sidehopper Kill
note: Open the door and kill the first hopper from inside the doorway. It won't be able to hit Samus for many jumps.
It is possible to quickly get back to the right and crouch against the the ledge while aiming upward to safely kill the Sidehopper.
Alternatively, morph can help with the second hopper, as it won't be able to hit Samus.

strats.name: Use Flash Suit, Diagonal Spark on Entry
note: Diagonal spark immediately on entry in order to kill the first Sidehopper.
The second can be killed safely by luring it to the door and crouching against the ledge. Alternatively, it cannot hit Samus while she is morphed.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Power Bomb Kill
strats.note: Use 1-3 Power Bombs to kill the Sidehoppers.

strats.name: X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 1 screen.

strats.name: Very Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
note: Enter with G-mode direct, back up to between 1 and 6 pixels from the door transition, and activate X-ray to get very deep stuck in the door.
Climb up 1 screen, and perform a turnaround buffered spin-jump away from the door to trigger the transition, bypassing any lock on the door.

strats.name: Pink Prinstar Power Bomb Grapple Teleport Inside Wall
note: Enter the room in a pose that allows Samus to stand.
After teleporting, retract Grapple by pressing up.
Then hold right to release Grapple while standing.
Samus should get pushed up onto the floor.
Run to the right and reach the door, taking just one hit from a Hopper.

strats.name: Pink Brinstar Power Bombs Crystal Flash Clip
note: Perform the crystal flash all the way to the left, against the crumble blocks to prevent the elevator on the right from blocking you in.
Simply jump after performing the crystal flash to jump through the floor.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Overload PLMs with Bombs
strats.note: Place Bombs against the side of the crumble block until PLMs are overloaded, then go through.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Direct Overload PLMs with Power Bombs
strats.note: Place two Power Bombs, precisely on the third tile in the morph tunnel to overload PLMs (watch the right side of the screen).
devNote: Because of the gates, it costs 2 Power Bombs to get into the tunnel and 2 to get out the other side.
There is no canRiskPermanentLossOfAccess, because there is no reason to go here except to get the item and leave.

strats.name: Mission Impossible

failures.name: Crumble Failure
failures.note: Failure leaves you at 3 with a solid crumble block above.

note: Perform a quick-drop through the Crumble block, and grab the item.
During the item message box, buffer the inputs to turn around to the right and jump.
Perform a wall jump by briefly releasing and repressing jump (while continuing to hold right) after hitting the respawning crumble block, to clip up through it.
strats.devNote: This expects that the Sidehoppers are dead. To avoid redundant requirements, they must be killed coming in.

strats.name: Mission Impossible Walljumpless

failures.name: Crumble Failure
failures.note: Failure leaves you at 3 with a solid crumble block above.

note: Perform a quick-drop through the Crumble block, and grab the item.
During the item message box, buffer the inputs to turn around to the right and jump.
Break spin just before you would hit the respawning crumble block, in order to clip up through it.
Then perform a crumble jump to make it out.
strats.devNote: This expects that the Sidehoppers are dead. To avoid redundant requirements, they must be killed coming in.

strats.name: Mission Impossible Shinespark

failures.name: Crumble Failure
failures.note: Failure leaves you at 3 with a solid crumble block above.

note: Gain a shinecharge by running right-to-left, either using the short runway (with unbroken Super block) or an extended runway by taking a spike hit.
Then spin jump, hit the ceiling, aim down, break the Super block, and turn around to quick drop through the crumble block.
During the item message box, buffer the inputs to turn around to the right and jump.
Once under the crumble block (the left part of it), press up while still holding jump, to immediately activate the spark and make it up in time.
strats.devNote: This expects that the Sidehoppers are dead. To avoid redundant requirements, they must be killed coming in.

strats.name: Mission Impossible Shinespark (Flash Suit)

failures.name: Crumble Failure
failures.note: Failure leaves you at 3 with a solid crumble block above.

note: Spin jump, hit the ceiling, aim down, break the Super block, and turn around to quick drop through the crumble block.
During the item message box, buffer the inputs to turn around to the right and jump.
Once under the crumble block (the left part of it), press up while still holding jump, to immediately activate the spark and make it up in time.
strats.devNote: This expects that the Sidehoppers are dead. To avoid redundant requirements, they must be killed coming in.

strats.name: Base
strats.devNote: This link is only useful after Mission Impossible, which already requires the hoppers to be killed.

nodes.name: Top Junction
nodes.note: Represents being on the Grapple block if going right or to the right of the gate, if going left.

nodes.name: Frozen Hopper Junction
nodes.note: Represents being with the Hoppers, one of them is frozen, and they are no longer a threat to Samus.

strats.name: Power Beam Kill
note: This assumes you don't know you're entering this room, and take a Small Sidehopper hit quickly.
The Small Sidehoppers may deliver more of the hits, but this is an assumed worst case scenario

strats.name: Intermediate Weapon Kill
strats.note: This assumes you don't know you're entering this room, and take a Small Sidehopper hit quickly.

strats.name: Fast Weapon Kill
strats.note: This assumes you don't know you're entering this room, and take a Small Sidehopper hit quickly.

strats.name: Stacked Super Kill
strats.note: Weaken the big hopper with a Power Beam shot and then use one Super to hit all three enemies when they stack together.

strats.name: Kill on Entry (Come In With Blue Speed)
Kill on Entry (Come In With Spark)
Kill on Entry (Come In With Unmorph Power Bomb Boost)
note: Bounce on the Power Bomb, then quickly kill the remaining Sidehopper with a strong beam, ammo, or pseudo-screw.
If Samus has a weak beam, use the bomb to boost to the right to get the Sidehopper to jump to the right, then morph under it while killing it.
strats.devNote: This is significantly easier than a typical canUnmorphBombBoost, so it is instead modeled with canJumpIntoIBJ and canResetFallSpeed.

strats.name: Pink Hopper Reverse Gate Glitch (HiJump)
note: Jump straight up and shoot with the correct timing.
This strat involves shooting a Super diagonally from the correct height while flush against the left wall.
Its acceleration will cause it to clip into the blue gate off-screen.
devNote: Springball jumps didn't look possible but was close.
IBJ didn't look possible.

strats.name: Pink Hopper Reverse Gate Glitch (HiJump, Hoppers Alive)
note: Use damage from the small sidehopper to align against the left wall.
Jump straight up and shoot with the correct timing.
This strat involves shooting a Super diagonally from the correct height while flush against the left wall.
Its acceleration will cause it to clip into the blue gate off-screen.

strats.name: Pink Hopper Reverse Gate Glitch (SpaceJump)
note: Use a stationary spinjump, or spinjump against the wall and turn around without moving; and shoot with the same correct timing.
This strat involves shooting a Super diagonally from the correct height while flush against the left wall.
Its acceleration will cause it to clip into the blue gate off-screen.

strats.name: Pink Hopper Reverse Gate Glitch (Speedy Jump)
note: Build run speed and jump into the left wall, turning around without changing Samus' pixel position.
This strat involves shooting a Super diagonally from the correct height while flush against the left wall.
Its acceleration will cause it to clip into the blue gate off-screen.
strats.devNote: The reverse gate glitch requires killing the enemies first, so it's required here.

strats.name: Pink Hopper Reverse Gate Glitch (Door Frame Jump)
note: A consistent setup is to align with the wall below the door frame facing right.
Jump and turn around to land on the door frame.
Then jump and turn around again to return to being aligned with the wall but at the right height for shooting the Super.
This strat involves shooting a Super diagonally from the correct height while flush against the left wall.
Its acceleration will cause it to clip into the blue gate off-screen.
devNote: The reverse gate glitch pretty much requires killing the enemies first, so it's required here.
FIXME: direct GMode would have a usable door frame.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Indirect to Despawn Gate Power Bomb Kill
strats.note: Kill the Sidehoppers with a Power Bomb upon entry.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Hopper (Jump Entry)
note: This is possible to do without taking a second hit:
Enter the room in a jump, then shoot down to open the door and land in the doorsill.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Hopper
note: This is possible to do without taking a second hit:
Enter the room in a jump, then shoot down to open the door and land in the doorsill.
devNote: Version for entering from the right, or if unable to enter jumping.
A Power Bomb would kill the hoppers.

strats.name: IBJ
devNote: IBJ requires the enemies to be killed
The reverse gate glitch may be executed earlier from node 1 -> 1.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Indirect to Despawn Gate with IBJ
strats.note: Kill the Sidehoppers with Bombs or a Power Bomb, then IBJ up onto the Grapple block.

strats.name: Base
strats.devNote: The reverse gate glitch may be executed earlier from node 1 -> 1.

strats.name: Speedy Jump Onto Grapple Block
strats.note: Run from the left side to the right, then jump just before or at the end of the runway to get up onto the Grapple block.

strats.name: Spring Ball from the Doorframe
note: Perform a very precise Spring Ball jump from the doorframe onto the Grapple block.
A running spin jump or crouch jump can be used.
strats.devNote: FIXME: Direct GMode would have a usable door frame.

strats.name: Speedy Jump
strats.note: Jump into the room and onto the Grapple block.

strats.name: Tricky Speedy Jump
strats.note: Jump into the room and onto the Grapple block.

strats.name: Speedy HiJump
strats.note: Jump into the room and onto the Grapple block.

strats.name: Tricky Speedy HiJump
strats.note: Jump into the room and onto the Grapple block. Requires a runway of only 2 tiles in the adjacent room.
strats.devNote: It can be done with no open ends, but it's a fair bit tighter.

strats.name: Cross-Room Spring Ball Jump
strats.note: Perform a Spring Ball jump from a speedy jump in the previous room.

strats.name: Tricky Cross-Room Spring Ball Jump
note: Perform a very precise Spring Ball jump through the transition and onto the Grapple block.
A running spin jump or crouch jump can be used.

strats.name: Spring Ball Bounce
strats.note: Come in with a spring ball bounce after gaining speed on a remote runway using at least 34 tiles.
strats.devNote: This requires extra run speed of at least $6.0.

strats.name: Use Flash Suit
strats.note: Jump into the room and spark up onto the grapple block.

strats.name: Use Flash Suit (Water Entrance)
strats.note: Jump into the room and spark up onto the grapple block.
strats.devNote: The other strat should always be usable if there is air physics.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph IBJ
strats.note: Kill the Sidehoppers with Bombs or a Power Bomb, then IBJ up onto the Grapple block. Use Wave to get through.

strats.name: Pink Brinstar Hopper X-Ray Climb
note: To minimize damage from the Hoppers, get stuck in the door relatively high and move quickly.
Climb up somewhat less than 1 screen, until Samus' head appears between 1 and 3 tiles below the door.
Then perform a turn-around spin jump to the right to get on top of the Grapple block.
devNote: It is possible to avoid all Hopper damage, but it is not clear if this can be done reliably.
Two hits from the big Sidehopper appears to be a worst-case scenario.

strats.name: Hopper Freeze
note: Carefully freeze the hoppers without taking too much damage but also without accidently killing all of the enemies.
devNote: The Small Sidehoppers may deliver more of the hits, but this is an assumed worst case scenario

strats.name: Plasma SBA Sidehopper Kill
strats.devNote: This also raises the elevator, but using this method to get up is a bit obscure and would use the notable from 2->3.

strats.name: Ride the Elevator
strats.note: The elevator can be raised by hitting below the shot block with a Bomb.

strats.name: Elevator with Power Bombs or Wave
strats.note: Use a Power Bomb against the left wall or Wave to kill the enemies and ride the elevator.

strats.name: Pink Hoppers Shot Clip to Ride the Elevator
note: The elevator can be raised by clipping a shot into the floor, shot while falling with the right amount of vertical speed.
This can be done with a Missile, Super, or charged Spazer or Plasma shot, a well positioned angle Spazer shot while crouched, or an  or Ice SBA.
devNote: FIXME: Do we need leniency or another tech for this?
This is only notable as a way to avoid wall jumps.

strats.name: Speedy Jump
strats.note: Jump near the end of the runway in-room. Assumes there is a runway in the adjacent room of at least 37 tiles.

strats.name: Speedy HiJump
strats.note: Jump at the end of the runway in-room. Assumes there is a runway in the adjacent room of at least 7 tiles.

strats.name: Tricky Speedy Jump
strats.note: Jump at the end of the runway in-room. Assumes that a runway of exactly 29 tiles is used in the adjacent room.
strats.devNote: This requires extra run speed of exactly $6.0 or $6.1 when jumping.

strats.name: Tricky Speedy HiJump
strats.note: Jump at the very end of the runway in-room. Requires a runway in the adjacent room of at least 6 tiles.

strats.name: Tricky Speedy Spring Ball
strats.note: Jump at the very end of the runway in-room. Requires a runway in the adjacent room of at least 7 tiles.

strats.name: Pink Hoppers Screw and Kago to Ride the Elevator
note: Start the elevator ride by using Screw Attack or Pseudo Screw in the hole.
Kago the elevator to fall back in and hit the elevator again. This is much easier while the elevator is still rising, but can still be done with Morph afterwards.
Unless HiJump is owned, this will need to be done once more to get high enough to get to the blue gate.
strats.devNote: This is only notable as a way to avoid wall jumps.

strats.name: Spring Ball Bounce
strats.note: Come in with a spring ball bounce after gaining speed on a remote runway using at least 42 tiles.
strats.devNote: This requires extra run speed of at least $6.D.

strats.name: Spring Ball Bounce (Tricky Dash Jump)
strats.note: Come in with a spring ball bounce after gaining speed on a remote runway using exactly 32 tiles.
strats.devNote: This requires extra run speed of either $6.0 or $6.1

strats.name: Pink Hoppers Shinespark into the Wall to Ride the Elevator, Come in Shinecharging
strats.note: Shinesparking horizontally into the wall will trigger the elevator as Samus's echos hit it.

strats.name: Pink Hoppers Shinespark into the Wall to Ride the Elevator, Come in Shinecharged
strats.note: Shinesparking horizontally into the wall will trigger the elevator as Samus's echos hit it.

strats.name: Pink Hoppers Shinespark into the Wall to Ride the Elevator, Come in Shinesparking
strats.note: Shinesparking horizontally into the wall will trigger the elevator as Samus's echos hit it.

strats.name: Pink Hoppers Shinespark into the Wall to Ride the Elevator, Use Flash Suit
strats.note: Shinesparking horizontally into the wall will trigger the elevator as Samus's echos hit it.

strats.name: Pink Hoppers X-Ray Climb Spring Ball Jump
note: X-Ray climb until Samus is a little over halfway off screen; the position is not precise.
Face right, then do a turnaround buffer spin jump into a Spring Ball jump to reach the ledge.
The pause input can be pressed at the same time as the turnaround.
It helps to do an airball to gain horizontal speed.
The jump input after pausing should not be buffered, in order to allow a little time for the spring fling horizontal speed to take effect.

strats.name: Pink Hoppers X-Ray Climb HiJump Insane Jump
note: Get stuck 3 pixels inside the door, and X-ray climb to a precise height:
after just one pixel of Samus' feet are visible while crouching facing left, perform exactly 7 more X-Ray stand-ups.
Use X-ray to face left, then run and jump to barely make it onto the ledge.
devNote: 3 pixels stuck in the door is X position 478 (0x1DE).

strats.name: Pink Hoppers G-Mode Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb Insane Jump
note: Enter with G-Mode and use X-Ray to get stuck 9 pixels inside the door.
X-Ray climb to a relatively specific height:
after just one pixel of Samus' feet are visible while crouching facing left, perform between 20 and 22 more X-Ray stand-ups (any of these work).
Use X-ray to face left, then run and jump to barely make it onto the ledge.
devNote: 9 pixels stuck in the door is X position 484 (0x1E4).
The correct Y positions for the jump are 193 (0xC1), 188 (0xBC), and 187 (0xBB)
FIXME: Some of the X position to the left (482, 483) could also work; maybe investigate which vertical positions work for them?

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Elevator with Power Bomb
strats.note: Using a power bomb against the left wall will kill the enemies and trigger the elevator.

strats.name: Tank a Hit
strats.note: Jump far to the left in order to hit a small Sidehopper instead of a large one.

strats.name: Screw Kill
strats.note: It is possible to kill the Sidehoppers damageless by jumping into the bottom left corner then quickly spin jumping again.

strats.name: Frozen Hopper Platform
note: Use a Frozen Hopper as a platform to jump up to the Grapple Block with an additional movement item.
Letting it jump from the spike ledge or the door frame will make the jump easier, but it is difficult to avoid Hopper damage when setting this up.
strats.devNote: FIXME: A big hopper doing a high jump from the door frame is enough to reach the grapple block without a movement item.  This would need a full manip since it is hard to try to make happen.

strats.name: Pink Hopper Reverse Gate Glitch (Ice)
note: Freeze a small hopper to the side and kill the remaining Side Hoppers.
Stand against the left wall (damage knockback will align Samus with the wall) and shoot up to freeze the hopper.
Jump up to land on it, aligned with the wall.
Alternatively, Jump and shoot down to freeze the hopper as a way to avoid damage.
Fire a Super just above the door shell to hit the Gate.
This strat involves shooting a Super diagonally from the correct height while flush against the left wall.
Its acceleration will cause it to clip into the blue gate off-screen.

strats.name: Pink Hopper Reverse Gate Glitch (HiJump, Ice)
note: This strat involves shooting a Super diagonally from the correct height while flush against the left wall.
Its acceleration will cause it to clip into the blue gate off-screen.
Jump straight up and shoot with the correct timing.
Taking damage can be used to align against the wall.

to.devNote: FIXME: Moondance can be setup on the slope by freezing a new bug whenever the freeze effect expires.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Zeb
X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 8 screens.

strats.name: Very Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
note: Enter with G-mode direct, back up to between 1 and 6 pixels from the door transition, and activate X-ray to get very deep stuck in the door.
Climb up 8 screens, and perform a turnaround buffered spin-jump away from the door to trigger the transition, bypassing any lock on the door.

strats.name: G-Mode Overload PLMS with Camera Scroll Blocks
strats.note: Climb the shaft and overload PLMs with the camera scroll blocks which are against the crumble blocks.
devNote: This is mostly an alternative to the canBeVeryPatient X-Ray climb.
This is possible with an IBJ, but it's still about 3 minutes, and you can't remotely acquire the item because it's in a Chozo Ball.

strats.name: Leave Shinecharged
note: Stand to the right of the right-most bug pipe, and run to the right to gain a shortcharge.
Run back to the left, jump over the bug pipes with one jump, and exit through the left door.

strats.name: Leave Shinecharged (Space Jump)
note: Stand to the right of the right-most bug pipe, and run to the right to gain a shortcharge.
Run back to the left, Space Jump over the bug pipes, and exit through the left door.

strats.name: Leave With Shinespark
note: Stand to the right of the right-most bug pipe, and run to the right to gain a shortcharge.
Run back to the left, jump over the bug pipes, and shinespark through the left door.

strats.name: Leave Spinning (Space Jump)
strats.devNote: A variation with 1 more runway tile could be added for if the door at node 2 is unlocked, and the same for the other remote runway strats.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Zeb
G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Zeb
Zero Farm
devNote: FIXME: The h_heatProof requirement is because Zeros only drop small energy, not enough to guarantee progress if the neighboring room is heated
Later we should remove this in favor of some way to require that the neighboring room is not heated.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Zero
note: The timing to get hit by these guys is a bit tighter, since they are so slow. Buffering their movement with x-ray can help.

strats.name: Speedball (Come in With Blue Speed)
note: Roll through the whole room, breaking the speedblocks.
The fish enemies will die but some puyos will remain.

strats.name: Come In With Blue Spring Ball Bounce
strats.devNote: Higher run speeds can also work but may require more landing tiles if the speedball occurs just before the transition.

strats.name: Grapple Teleport
devNote: This strat has limited usefulness since you will be stuck behind the speed blocks.
Potentially it could be useful if you could use a flash suit to get out (though this is not yet logic);
for example, the item could be an Energy Tank and you could need its refill in order to spark out (rather than sparking in).
It also could be useful if the game were modified to allow retaining items after resetting.

strats.name: Waterway Grapple Teleport Inside Wall
note: Enter the room in a pose that allows Samus to stand.
After teleporting, retract Grapple by pressing up.
Then hold right to release Grapple while standing.
Samus should get pushed up onto the floor.
devNote: This strat has limited usefulness since you will be stuck behind the speed blocks.
Potentially it could be useful if you could use a flash suit to get out (though this is not yet logic);
for example, the item could be an Energy Tank and you could need its refill in order to spark out (rather than sparking in).
It also could be useful if the game were modified to allow retaining items after resetting.

strats.name: Space Jump
strats.note: Space Jump across the room, starting from the door, to reach the dry platform.

strats.name: Spring Ball Jump
strats.note: Press pause slightly before jumping into morph, in order ensure Samus still has upward momentum when the pause fade-out finishes.

strats.name: Frozen Caterpillar
note: Watch a Zero (Caterpillar) climb along the ceiling before knocking it down near the speed blocks.
Freeze it and jump on top.  Escape the water with a spinjump or crouch jump.

strats.name: Leave With Spark
strats.note: Charge a spark on the dry platform, and jump into a mid-air spark across the room and through the door.

strats.name: Leave With Spark (Big Jump)
strats.note: Charge a spark going left, then build speed and jump far to the right into a mid-air spark across the room and through the door.

strats.name: Leave With Controlled Spring Ball Bounce
Leave With Temporary Blue (Speedball)
note: Perform a speedball into a temporary blue chain to reach the door.
If HiJump and Spring Ball are unavailable, then getting out of the water requires a very precise jump:
delay aiming down for the mid-air morph until after Samus is above the water line.

strats.name: Leave With Temporary Blue (Space Jump)
note: Gain blue speed, then Space Jump across the room, ending in temporary blue chain to reach the door.

strats.name: Suitless Spark
note: Run from left to right on the dry platform to gain a shinecharge.
Then fall off and spark to the left to break the speed blocks.
strats.devNote: Doable without a short charge, since there are 32 tiles (plus one open end) to charge it.

strats.name: Temporary Blue Chain
note: This is a long temporary blue chain to make it through all the speed blocks.
If possible, destroy the enemies beforehand using Wave or a Power Bomb;
otherwise, carefully kill them individually with temporary blue.
